intro: Rhytidophyllum plumerianum, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its thick, waxy leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a small shrub, often with a compact and bushy appearance.
